span.strong: News & Information From Benton-Carroll-Salem School District

p.span: The Regular Meeting of the B-C-S Board of Education set for April 28, 2020 at 5:00 PM will be streamed live at the website above due to the Covid-19 Crisis.

a.title: Print article < B-C-S Hub of Information >
Email this link to a friend

p.span: By order of the State of Ohio, our school buildings will remain closed to students for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year.

Benton-Carroll-Salem School District will continue our Remote Instruction Plan through the end of this school year. The last day of teaching and learning will be May 29, 2020 (the originally scheduled last day of school).

div.style: text-align: left; color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: 13.33px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2;

text-align: left; color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: 13.33px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2;
div.span: It is important that our students remain focused on their learning for the remaining school days. The work students are completing will continue to count toward their grade. Our teachers will continue to be working with students to make sure they have the essential skills they need to be successful in the next grade level. I wish to again thank the dedication of our teachers and students for the creativity, flexibility, and resilience you have shown through this crisis.

div.style: text-align: left; color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: 13.33px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2;

text-align: left; color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: 13.33px; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: 400; text-decoration: none; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2;
div.span: All Spring Activities including athletics have also been cancelled: We are deeply saddened for our students who are missing out on these opportunities. We all remain very proud of you!

p.span: -Ottawa County Top Ten Banquet set for April 15: Postponed to June 24.
-Kindergarten Screening set for April 8-9: Postponed--to be determined.
-Camp Michindoh trip for 6th grade has been cancelled. We are working to return payments to those who have made them.

div.p: -7th Grade Cedar Point Trip: Cancelled and will not be rescheduled. Payment will be returned to those who have paid.

div.style: text-align: center; color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;
div.span: For the Week of April 20 and beyond, we will be serving meals on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays only. On Mondays and Wednesdays, students will get two days worth of meals. On Fridays, students will get one day of meals.

div.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;
div.span: We are making this change to limit the exposure of all involved in this process.

div.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;
div.span: Meals will continue to be FREE to all Benton-Carroll-Salem students. The meal distribution site for all students will continue to be R.C. Waters Elementary School. Delivery of meals will still be available on the days we are serving meals. Please be sure to call (419) 898-6219 between 8 AM and 10 AM to request your delivery.
The Meal Service will continue through May 29, 2020.

h2.a: Remote Instruction Plan & Other Important Information

a.title: Print article < Remote Instruction Plan & Other Important Information >
Email this link to a friend

a.span: Benton-Carroll-Salem School District has implemented a Remote Instruction Plan beginning Monday, March 16, 2020 to continue as high quality teaching and learning as possible. This Remote Instruction plan will continue through the end of the 2019-20 school year. Flexibility is key during this period. Be calm. Be well. Be kind.

p.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

span.b: Does the work of students during Remote Instruction Count?

p.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-bottom: 0pt; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

div.p: Yes, the Remote Instruction school work that students are completing does count! According to HB 197, the teaching and learning taking place remotely (both online and paper based) will count, and will allow us to consider these days as “in-session” school days even though students are not reporting to a physical school building. Therefore, the district is not anticipating making up school days in the summer.

p.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

div.p: These are challenging times for adults, and more so for young people. If you think your child can benefit from talking to a counselor, please do not hesitate to call your child's school on March 30 or after. I also want to remind you of the Crisis Text Line:

div.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

div.p: Text HOME to 741741 from anywhere in the United States, anytime, about any type of crisis.

p.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;
p.span: One suggestion for our overall mental health is for us to all get outside and walk, or do some kind of physical activity (while practicing social distancing). Something as simple as a walk can do wonders for the mood and help with anxiety.

p.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

span.b: What is happening with Commencement for the Class of 2020?

p.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; margin-top: 0in; margin-right: 0in; margin-bottom: 0pt; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

div.p: Commencement is a seminal moment in the lives of young people! We may have to postpone the OHHS Commencement (May 17) due to an Ohio Department of Health Order limiting the number of people who can get together. We are considering options and alternatives if we are forced to postpone Commencement. We will strive to have a traditional, face to face Commencement. We believe our Class of 2020 deserves to have this memory and recognition! Stay tuned.

p.style: color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

div.p: The latest news and information will be sent via emails and will be posted to the front page of the district website, www.bcssd.com. You can also follow the Superintendent on Twitter: @BCS_Supt

p.style: text-align: center; color: #222222; text-transform: none; text-indent: 0px; letter-spacing: normal; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; font-style: normal; font-weight: 400; word-spacing: 0px; white-space: normal; orphans: 2; widows: 2; background-color: #ffffff;

b.span: Be Calm. Be Well. Be Kind.

h2.a: RC Waters Elementary Kindergarten Registration and Screening

a.title: Print article < RC Waters Elementary Kindergarten Registration and Screening >
Email this link to a friend

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;

span.style: font-family: Assistant, sans-serif; font-size: 14.6667px; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: RC Waters Elementary Kindergarten Registration and Screening

p.style: color: #222222; font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 10pt;

span.style: font-size: 11pt; font-family: Assistant, sans-serif; color: #000000; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap;

p.span: Kindergarten Screening appointments scheduled for April 8 & 9 at R.C. Waters Elementary have been postponed. Stay tuned for an announcement on a future date. In order to be eligible for kindergarten, a child must be 5 years old by August 1. All kindergarten students should be screened and registered to begin the school year.

div.p: Copyright © 2016 Benton Carroll Salem Local Schools.
